page.title: 11OUR NEW HOMES
page.content: Nearly everyone in our school has moved into a new house. All except for one short street of old houses have been demolished. Many of them were prefabs left from the war. So is our school which is old and falling to bits. Newham Council, Comben, Wimpey, Barratt, Brosley, Sellards, Goldings, Hay & Croft, Bennets, Wilmot, Jerams are all busy building houses of all designs, flats studio flats, maisonettes all in pleasant red brick with cobbled squares and closses. But apart from a few shops there are no other amenities. Even so, many people are moving in. Not many houses stay empty for long. We asked in school and found that 23 families lived here before the new building, 59 came from other parts of Newham, 5 from London and 6 from abroad.
